NEW DELHI: Opener Rohit Sharma struck an unbeaten century, Virat Kohli made a fighting half-century, and pacer Harshit Rana grabbed four wickets as India defeated Australia by nine wickets in the third and final ODI on Saturday, though they lost the series 1-2.Rana’s brilliant spell of 4/39 helped bowl Australia out for 236 in 46.4 overs, setting the stage for a dominant Indian chase. Rohit then led the way with an unbeaten 121 off 125 balls. He first shared a crucial 69-run opening partnership with Shubman Gill (24) before joining forces with Kohli (74* off 81 balls) for an unbroken 168-run stand, guiding India to the target in 38.3 overs.After reaching his half-century, Kohli initially forgot to acknowledge the crowd or celebrate, until Rohit signaled him to mark the milestone.Watch the video here During the innings, Kohli also broke another record, becoming the second-highest run-getter in ODI cricket. The No.3 batter, famously known as the 'Chase Master,' overcame subdued form in the first two ODIs to register his 75th ODI fifty and surpass 2,500 runs against Australia in the format.Kohli also surpassed Sri Lankan great Kumar Sangakkara’s tally of 14,234 runs (in 404 ODIs) in his 293rd ODI innings. The former India captain now sits just behind legendary Sachin Tendulkar , who leads with 18,426 runs. Impressively, Kohli maintains a superior average of 57.69 across 305 ODIs, compared to Tendulkar’s 44.83 in 463 matches.With his career nearing its end in ODIs, Kohli is set to finish as the second-highest run-getter behind his idol, Tendulkar.In the match, Kohli’s unbeaten 74, including seven fours, and Rohit’s 33rd ODI ton — which was also his 50th international century — powered India to a nine-wicket victory at the Sydney Cricket Ground, even as Australia secured the series 2-1. Rohit was named both Player of the Match and Player of the Series for scoring 202 runs across three games.The two sides will now clash in a five-match T20I series, beginning October 29.
Article Summary: India defeated Australia by nine wickets in the third and final ODI on Saturday. Opener Rohit Sharma struck an unbeaten century, and Virat Kohli made a fighting half-century. Pacer Harshit Rana grabbed four wickets as India lost the series 1-2.

Article Title: Tribal Ju-Jitsu athlete found dead at home in MP's Dewas
Article Text:
Rohini Kalam Jujitsu player (Picture Credit: IG/senseirohinikalam)

INDORE: Rohini Kalam, a 30-year-old Ju-Jitsu (martial art) athlete who represented India in the Asian Games and won bronze at the International Ju-Jitsu Competition in Abu Dhabi last year, was found hanging at her home in MP's Dewas.Police suspect suicide but clarified that no note was recovered from Rohini's room at the time she was found hanging on Sunday. The tragedy comes days after two Australian players for ICC Women's Cricket World Cup were allegedly molested in MP's Indore.Roshni, one of Rohini's younger sisters, first saw the athlete hanging at their home in Arjun Nagar area of Dewas and took her to hospital, where doctors declared her dead. Their parents were away at the time along with other family members, police said. Rohini was the eldest of four sisters.Roshni recalled Rohini behaving normally on Sunday morning, sharing tea and breakfast, and speaking to someone on the phone before going to her room and closing the door. Dewas SP Punit Gehlot said a probe was underway.Rohini worked as a martial arts coach at a private school and had returned home just a day ago. Family sources said Rohini was struggling to continue practice following an abdominal surgery but was hoping to bag MP govt's Vikram Award for sporting excellence.Veer Renga Korku Samaj Seva Samiti, a tribal group, has sought an impartial probe and action against those responsible. Rohini was the first tribal female athlete to represent India in Ju-Jitsu internationally.
Article Summary: Rohini Kalam, 30, a Ju-Jitsu (martial art) athlete, found hanging at her home in Dewas. Police suspect suicide but no note was recovered from Rohini's room at the time she was found hanging on Sunday.

Article Title: Retired NHL star Ryan Kesler faces fourth-degree criminal sexual conduct charges as he prepares legal defense
Article Text:
Former NHL star Ryan Kesler faces serious legal trouble, charged with two counts of fourth-degree criminal sexual conduct. The 41-year-old pleaded not guilty in a Michigan courtroom. His attorney vehemently denies the allegations, calling them baseless. This marks a dramatic shift from Kesler's celebrated career on the ice, including Olympic appearances and a Stanley Cup Final run.

Ryan Kesler pleads not guilty as legal process begins to unfold

From Olympic podiums to court proceedings: a dramatic turn for the former center

Former NHL center Ryan Kesler is back in the spotlight, but this time it is far from the arena lights that once celebrated his two-way dominance. The 41-year-old, who built a career battling top forwards and representing Team USA on the Olympic stage, is now battling misdemeanor charges in a Michigan courtroom.According to court filings, Ryan Kesler has been charged with two counts of fourth-degree criminal sexual conduct related to alleged events that took place on January 1. He appeared in a Bloomfield Hills courtroom on Monday, where he formally entered a not guilty plea. After being booked and posting a $50,000 bond, he was released while the case moved forward. A probable cause conference is currently scheduled for November 6.Police in Orchard Lake confirmed the arraignment but declined to release further details, leaving many unanswered questions surrounding the accusations.Kesler’s attorney, Robert Morad, issued a strong statement to The Athletic, saying, “Ryan emphatically denies the allegations and is completely innocent of the charges. The charges are baseless and he is prepared to fight them vigorously in court.” Morad added, “As the legal process begins, we ask for respect for his privacy and for the integrity of the judicial system.We are confident, when all the facts and circumstances are presented, that he will be fully exonerated. ”Kesler spent 15 years in the NHL, starring for the Vancouver Canucks and later the Anaheim Ducks before injuries led to his retirement in 2019. Fans remember him as a fierce competitor, a Selke Trophy winner, and a central figure in Vancouver’s run to the 2011 Stanley Cup Final. He also served as a key member of the U.S. men’s Olympic teams in 2010 and 2014, earning a silver medal in Vancouver.Now, instead of highlighting reels and accolades, his career legacy hangs in the balance of a legal battle still in its earliest stages. As the NHL community watches closely, the next chapter of Ryan Kesler’s life will be written not on the ice, but inside a courtroom.Also Read: “Embarrassing for McDavid”: Fans lose their minds as Ryan Reaves outscoring Connor McDavid becomes early-season reality

Article Title: Why New Orleans Pelicans Zion Williamson missed the game against Boston Celtics
Article Text:

Zion Williamson ruled out minutes before tip-off against the Boston Celtics

Zion Williamson opened the new season looking sharper, stronger, and more dominant than ever

The New Orleans Pelicans' star forward, Zion Williamson, was out for his team's game against the Boston Celtics because of a left foot bone bruise. This was the first absence for the 25-year-old power forward in the 2025-26 NBA season, where he had been a strong presence in the Pelicans' early games. The injury came as a surprise, increasing the early-season anxiety for a Pelicans team already dealing with a 0-2 record.Williamson wasn't able to play due to a bone bruise in his left foot, which leads to pain and swelling in the bone without any fractures. The Pelicans listed him as questionable on their injury report earlier on October 28, but they decided to rule him out about 90 minutes before the game at the Smoothie King Center in New Orleans.During a pre-game media availability, head coach Willie Green discussed the timeline with reporters, “It’s something that kind of popped up this morning. It didn’t seem like it was too serious. But I’m not sure.”Green elaborated on the issue's background to the media, mentioning that he thought the injury happened during the Pelicans' overtime defeat against the San Antonio Spurs. Williamson played a season-high of 36 minutes and 59 seconds in that 128-125 loss, racking up 27 points, 10 rebounds, seven assists, and three steals despite the intense pace.There were no earlier symptoms noted during the game, and Green assured reporters, “Not that I know of,” when asked if Williamson had shown signs of discomfort on the court.NBA insider Brett Siegel of ClutchPoints provided an update via X shortly before the game, posting, “Zion Williamson is dealing with a left foot bone contusion and is currently listed as questionable to play tonight for the Pelicans against the Celtics. This is a new injury for Williamson.” Siegel later confirmed the final status in a follow-up, stating directly, “Zion Williamson is OUT tonight for the Pelicans,” in reference to the Celtics contest.Prior to getting injured, Zion Williamson was showing one of the most productive and flexible performances of his career. In the first two games for the Pelicans with a 118-105 loss to the Memphis Grizzlies on October 23 and the previously mentioned loss to the Spurs where he averaged 27 points, 9.5 rebounds, six assists, and four steals per game, playing around 35.2 minutes on average. His four steals per game put him in a tie with Chicago Bulls guard Tre Jones for the NBA lead at that early stage.In the opening match against Memphis, Williamson scored 27 points, shooting a solid 11-of-15. He also grabbed nine rebounds, dished out five assists, and made five steals in only 33 minutes.A couple of nights later, while up against San Antonio Spurs, he matched his scoring from before but had a way more balanced stat line, showing off his improved playmaking and defense. This amazing stretch comes from a summer spent getting in shape, where Williamson reportedly shed some pounds and worked on his durability to tackle his past issues.A little injury feels way worse when it’s related to Zion Williamson. His strong performance in the first few games showed a boost in confidence that the Pelicans desperately required. But missing games this early is a real test for both the player and the organization. The team has to find a way to balance their need for quick wins with the long-term care of their star player.Also Read: Giannis Antetokounmpo just did what players like Michael Jordan and LeBron James couldn’t do

Retired New York Jets center Nick Mangold passed away at the age of 41 after suffering from the complications of kidney disease Saturday night, the team announced on Sunday morning. Mangold was battling chronic kidney disease for nearly 19 years and was also undergoing dialysis for it. Just 10 days back, the former Ohio State Buckeyes center posted on social media asking for a kidney donor with type O blood.Mangold was diagnosed with a genetic defect that led to chronic kidney disease. He underwent dialysis, but after a difficult summer, he began looking for a kidney transplant. He knew the day was coming, but he always thought he had more time. Since no family members were able to donate, he reached out to the public on social media. The Jets legend’s social media post asking for a kidney donor read—“In 2006, I was diagnosed with a genetic defect that has led to chronic kidney disease. After a rough summer, I’m undergoing dialysis as we look for a kidney transplant. I always knew this day would come, but I thought I would have had more time. Unfortunately, I do not have any family able to donate at this time, so this is why I’m reaching out to you, our NY Jets and Ohio State communities.I am in need of a kidney donor with type O blood.” Mangold had also shared the website details to find out if the donor was a match for him. He later expressed gratitude to anyone willing to consider donating to him. “I am deeply grateful to anyone that would consider donating,” the Jets center wrote.“Most of all, I’m thankful for my family, who have been my rock every step of the way. This situation has reminded me how lucky I am to have such an amazing family, friends, and community behind me,” Mangold expressed gratitude in his October 14 social media post.The Jets star was looking forward to getting back to full strength—“While this has been a tough stretch, I’m staying positive and focused on the path ahead. I’m looking forward to better days and getting back to full strength soon. I’ll see you all at MetLife Stadium & The Shoe very soon.”“Nick was more than a legendary center. He was the heartbeat of our offensive line for a decade and a beloved teammate whose leadership and toughness defined an era of Jets football. Off the field, Nick’s wit, warmth, and unwavering loyalty made him a cherished member of our extended Jets family,” Jets owner Woody Johnson said in a statement.Jets' former offensive tackle D'Brickashaw Ferguson told NYJets.com Contributor, Randy Lange, "A big part of our lives were spent on that field. Then very early on, I was at his wedding, there were so many times where we shared life together, family events. I do appreciate having had that opportunity to do life with him, and not only him but his family, everyone else on that stage...it's a hard time."
Article Summary: Mangold was diagnosed with a genetic defect that led to chronic kidney disease. He underwent dialysis, but after a difficult summer, he began looking for a kidney transplant. Since no family members were able to donate, he reached out to the public on social media. He later expressed gratitude to anyone willing to consider donating.

Article Title: Pipe down, Surya! India need runs from their captain, not punchlines
Article Text:

Why coach Gautam was very Gambhir during India nets

NEW DELHI: Since taking over the T20I captaincy from Rohit Sharma, Suryakumar Yadav has acted like a pied piper, but his bat has lost its tune.During the title-winning Asia Cup run, the 35-year-old made headlines not for his breathtaking shots or match-winning knocks, but for his theatrics. From refusing to shake hands with Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha to sitting out the league game against Oman, Suryakumar Yadav has been in the spotlight for all the wrong reasons -- trying too hard to channel his inner Rohit Sharma by forgetting player names at tosses, downplaying the India-Pakistan rivalry, dabbling in political remarks, and giving endless interviews.If one were to believe all that he has said across the countless interviews he’s given, it might seem as though he’s steered India to the T20 World Cup. In reality, it was the Asia Cup -- a tournament where India were overwhelming favourites and even a second-string side could have beaten the current dysfunctional Pakistan team.India won the Asia Cup and defeated Pakistan thrice, but amid all this noise, captain Suryakumar Yadav’s poor form went unnoticed.In eleven innings this year, India’s T20I captain has managed just 100 runs at a strike rate of 105.26. Since becoming skipper, he has scored 330 runs in 20 innings with two fifties to his name.The saving grace for him had been the 2025 Indian Premier League (IPL), where the Mumbai Indians batter slammed 717 runs in 16 innings at an explosive strike rate of 167.90.But the focus now is on lifting the T20 World Cup title once again - on home soil at that. Will chief selector Ajit Agarkar and coach Gautam Gambhir overlook Surya’s slump?TimesofIndia.com understands that Surya has the backing of the team management till the 2026 World Cup, but the big question remains -- how long can his barren run go ignored?On Monday, coach Gautam Gambhir backed the T20 skipper. “Honestly, Surya’s batting form doesn’t concern me because we have committed to an ultra-aggressive template in our dressing room. When you embrace this philosophy, failures are inevitable,” he said during a discussion on JioHotstar.“It would be easy for Surya to score 40 off 30 balls and avoid criticism, but we have collectively decided that it’s acceptable to fail while pursuing this approach,” he added.Gambhir has also supported Surya’s “free-spirited” off-field personality, saying it has given the youngsters freedom and expression to play their game.But Gambhir knows that his words will be futile if Suryakumar Yadav’s poor form continues in the five-match T20I series against Australia starting Wednesday.Surya has gone without a fifty in his last 14 innings — unusual for him — and his mode of dismissals in the Asia Cup suggests opponents have found a chink in his armour.Barring an unbeaten 47 against arch-rivals Pakistan in the group stage, he looked all at sea against both pace and spin. His eagerness to play the sweep shot against spinners and premeditated flicks has often cost him his wicket. In Dubai, the pitches were two-paced, but in Australia he’ll face bouncier tracks — as the ODI series already hinted.After winning the Asia Cup final, while addressing questions on ‘handshake-gate’ and the trophy-less celebration, Surya looked uncomfortable when asked about his form. He said: “I feel I am not out of form, I feel I am out of runs.”With five months to go for the T20 World Cup, Suryakumar Yadav will be desperate to rediscover his touch -- because no team wants a struggling captain heading into a global showpiece event.

Article Title: Prithvi Shaw scripts Ranji Trophy history with double century: All the records he broke during 156-ball 222
Article Text:

Records Prithvi Shaw broke with his 222 (156)



Second-fastest double century in Ranji Trophy Elite Group history

– Reached his double hundred in 141 balls, only behind Ravi Shastri’s 123-ball double ton (1984/85)

Fastest double century in the 21st century in Ranji Trophy (Elite Group)

– Surpassed his own previous record of 174 balls set against Baroda in the 2019/20 season

Sixth-fastest century in Ranji Trophy history

– Reached his hundred in just 73 balls during the innings.

Second Indian to score multiple double hundreds in fewer than 200 balls in first-class cricket

– Joins Virender Sehwag in this elite club.

Only player besides Ravi Shastri to feature twice among the four fastest double centuries in Ranji Trophy’s Elite Group.

First player to score a double century for Maharashtra in the 2025–26 Ranji Trophy season.

Among only eight players in the world to have multiple double hundreds in fewer than 200 balls

– Joining legends like Sehwag and Graeme Hick

One of the few Indian players to hit double centuries at a strike rate above 140 in first-class cricket.

NEW DELHI The move from Mumbai to Maharashtra has paid immediate dividends for Prithvi Shaw , who produced a sensational double hundred in only his second outing for his new team. Playing against Chandigarh in the second round of the Ranji Trophy , Shaw blazed to a 156-ball 222, recording the second-fastest double century ever in the tournament’s Elite Group.Shaw reached the milestone in just 141 balls, surpassing Rahul Singh’s 2023/24 record, and now trails only Ravi Shastri’s iconic 123-ball double hundred from the 1984/85 season. The 25-year-old struck 29 boundaries and five sixes, maintaining a strike rate of 142.31, and also brought up his hundred in just 73 balls — the sixth-fastest in Ranji history.After parting ways with the Mumbai Cricket Association following a controversy-filled season, Shaw switched allegiance to Maharashtra, where he started with a century in a warm-up match. His Ranji Trophy campaign began quietly, with a duck in the first innings against Kerala, but his blistering knock against Chandigarh has turned heads once again.The innings not only marks a personal comeback but also places Shaw among Indian cricket’s elite. He now holds the record for the fastest double century in Ranji Trophy’s elite division in the 21st century, surpassing his own previous record of 174 balls (against Baroda in 2019/20).Only Shastri’s whirlwind effort remains faster in the 91-year history of the competition.Shaw is now the only batter besides Shastri to feature twice among the four fastest double centuries in the Ranji Trophy’s elite group. Including the plate division, Hyderabad’s Tanmay Agarwal holds the overall mark for the third-fastest double hundred in first-class cricket.The Maharashtra opener also joins Virender Sehwag as the second Indian to score multiple double hundreds in fewer than 200 balls in first-class cricket — a rare club shared by only eight players worldwide. Other notable Indians to have achieved rapid double hundreds include Rohit Sharma, Yuvraj Singh, Sachin Tendulkar, and Shreyas Iyer.Shaw’s 222 off 156 balls now stands as a reminder of his prodigious talent and potential resurgence. For a player once earmarked as India’s next big thing, this innings could well mark the start of a long-awaited comeback.
Article Summary: Prithvi Shaw scored 222 off 156 balls against Chandigarh in the Ranji Trophy. Shaw reached the milestone in just 141 balls, surpassing Rahul Singh’s 2023/24 record. The Maharashtra opener also joins Virender Sehwag as the second Indian to score multiple double hundreds in fewer than 200 balls in first-class cricket.

Article Title: All records Los Angeles Lakers star Austin Reaves has created in the 2025-26 NBA season: 51-point showdown and more
Article Text:

Here are all the records Austin Reaves has broken or created this season.



1. Career-high 51 points lift Los Angeles Lakers past Sacramento Kings

The Los Angeles Lakers guard Austin Reaves has been one of the biggest hits of the 2025-26 NBA season. His first came against the Indiana Pacers in February 2025, and his latest against the Kings added to his growing reputation.Austin Reaves set a new true shooting (TS) record for players with at least 50 points, eight rebounds, and eight assists in one game.His 80.5% TS has beaten Joel Embiid’s 76.5% previous mark from 2022. With this efficient scoring display, Reaves has proven that his offensive skills are powerful as well as precise.Reaves joined an exclusive list of Los Angeles Lakers stars with his 51-point performance. Since 2001, only Kobe Bryant, Shaquille O’Neal, LeBron James, and Anthony Davis have scored 50 or more in a game. Reaves became the fifth Laker to achieve that feat this century.Austin Reaves has joined the elite company with 51 points, 11 rebounds, nine assists, and six threes in one game. Before him, only former MVPs Russell Westbrook and James Harden had posted similar numbers. His performance showed that he belongs among the league’s best all-around guards.Also Read: 5 injury returns that could change the NBA landscape in 2025-26 NBA season

Article Title: Ex WNBA star Kysre Gondrezick gets stunning Playboy Magazine accolade
Article Text:
Kysre Gondrezick. Image via: Getty Images

Kysre Gondrezick breaks new ground in modeling and sports



Kysre Gondrezick building a personal brand



Kysre Gondrezick. Image via: Getty Images

Kysre Gondrezick is making headlines for more than her basketball skills. The former WNBA standout has been named Playboy’s Miss June 2025, marking a first in the magazine’s history: a professional female basketball player earning the Playmate title. While Gondrezick is currently a free agent, her Playboy honor shows her ability to balance athletic prowess with modeling as she evolves her career in different directions.Playboy officially introduced Gondrezick as Miss June 2025 on Monday, sharing a striking photo of the former Chicago Sky guard floating on an orange pool toy. In the caption, the magazine noted, “Kysre is the first current female professional basketball player to also take on the Playmate title.”Gondrezick herself emphasized that this transition is not a departure from her identity but an expansion. “What people label as a transition, I embody as evolution. I’m not stepping outside who I am. I’m building a multidimensional brand,” she said (via TMZ).Gondrezick’s basketball journey began at West Virginia and Michigan, leading to her selection as the fourth overall pick in the 2021 WNBA Draft. She played for the Indiana Fever in 2021 before joining the Chicago Sky in 2024.Reflecting on her time in the league, she said, “Becoming a WNBA player and getting to that level, you put in a lot of work to get there. You have to put in even more work to stay there.” Her dedication on the court now complements her growing success in modeling and brand ventures.Off the court, Gondrezick has leveraged her platform and striking presence, posting glamorous shots on social media that have drawn attention for years. The Playboy accolade confirms her growing influence beyond basketball. Recently, she joined the AU Pro Basketball league, signaling she hasn’t left the sport entirely but is charting a unique path that combines athleticism, media, and fashion.Gondrezick’s milestone with Playboy shows a broader shift and athletes can certainly redefine their careers while celebrating individuality. As she continues to navigate multiple industries, Kysre Gondrezick proves that excellence isn’t limited to one arena. As of now, she’s building a multidimensional brand for herself both on and off the court.Also Read: Indiana Fever drop surprising update on Caitlin Clark’s offseason activity amid injury rehabilitation

Article Title: Penguins fan hospitalized after shocking fall from upper level during game against Blues in Pittsburgh, team releases statement
Article Text:
Penguins fan hospitalized after tragic fall during game against Blues (Imagn Images)

Penguins issue statement on fan’s fall at PPG Paints Arena



Second fall in Pittsburgh sports venues within two days



A shocking scene unfolded at PPG Paints Arena on Monday night when a Pittsburgh Penguins fan fell from the upper concourse into the lower bowl during the team’s matchup against the St. Louis Blues. The incident occurred in the first period shortly after Anthony Mantha netted Pittsburgh’s second goal. Medical teams and emergency personnel quickly responded as the fan lay unconscious before being transported to a nearby hospital.The Pittsburgh Penguins later released an official statement confirming the incident:"The Pittsburgh Penguins can confirm that an adult male fell from the upper concourse to the lower bowl at PPG Paints Arena earlier this evening. The individual was immediately attended to by Pittsburgh EMS as well as PPG Paints Arena personnel and has since been transported to a local hospital. Although there is no further information at this time, the Penguins and OVG Management Group are closely monitoring the situation. Our concerns remain with the individual and his family at this time."According to reports, the man struck another spectator seated on the suite level as he fell toward Section 101.The individual who was hit received on-site medical evaluation but declined hospitalization, as reported by The Athletic.Despite the unsettling turn of events, the game continued, with the Penguins eventually defeating the Blues 6–3. Bryan Rust scored twice, while captain Sidney Crosby added a goal and two assists — including his 1,700th career point, placing him among the NHL’s all-time greats.After the game, Crosby expressed empathy for the injured fan, saying, “We just heard someone fell tonight. Doesn’t feel right to be talking about points. My thoughts and prayers to that person.”Disturbingly, this marks the second serious fall at a Pittsburgh sports venue in just two days. On Saturday night, before the Steelers hosted the Packers at Acrisure Stadium, a worker fell nearly 50 feet from the scoreboard onto a catwalk and remains in critical condition.While the Penguins’ victory was an on-ice highlight, the night was overshadowed by the fan’s fall — a sobering reminder of how quickly celebration can turn into concern. The organization and venue management continue to monitor the situation closely, emphasizing that their thoughts remain with the injured fan and his family.Also Read: Sidney Crosby hits incredible 1,700-point milestone, joining hockey’s most elite list in historic Penguins moment
Article Summary: Pittsburgh Penguins fan hospitalized after tragic fall during game against Blues. Incident occurred in the first period shortly after Anthony Mantha netted Pittsburgh’s second goal. According to reports, the man struck another spectator seated on the suite level as he fell toward Section 101.
